title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not correctly calculate Raymond Bank’s required reserves as $2,000 and/or does not show the work ( =0.10×$20,000=$2,000 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@47BF@

The response correctly calculates Raymond Bank’s required reserves as $2,000 and shows the work ( =0.10×$20,000=$2,000 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@47BF@

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not correctly calculate the maximum amount of loans that Raymond Bank can make as $3,000 and/or does not show the work. Excess Reserves=Total Reserves–Required Reserves=$5,000−$2,000=$3,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@70E6@

The response correctly calculates the maximum amount of loans that Raymond Bank can make as $3,000 and shows the work. Excess Reserves=Total Reserves–Required Reserves=$5,000−$2,000=$3,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@70E6@

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not accurately include either of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes the first criterion below, but not the second.
The response accurately includes both criteria below.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Raymond Bank's required reserves initially will remain the same and/or does not explain that there is no change in demand deposits or that only excess reserves increased.
The response states that Raymond Bank's required reserves initially will remain the same and explains that there is no change in demand deposits or that only excess reserves increased.
